solution_line_template: She works {regular_hours_per_day} hours a day for ${hourly_wage} per hour so she makes {regular_hours_per_day}*{hourly_wage} = $<<{regular_hours_per_day}*{hourly_wage}={base_pay_per_shift}>>{base_pay_per_shift} per 8-hour shift

She works {total_hours_per_day} hours a day and anything over {regular_hours_per_day} hours is eligible for overtime, so she gets {total_hours_per_day}-{regular_hours_per_day} = <<{total_hours_per_day}-{regular_hours_per_day}={overtime_hours_per_day}>>{overtime_hours_per_day} hours of overtime

Overtime is calculated as time and a half so and she makes ${hourly_wage}/hour so her overtime pay is {hourly_wage}*{overtime_multiplier} = $<<{hourly_wage}*{overtime_multiplier}={overtime_extra_per_hour}>>{overtime_extra_per_hour}

Her base pay is ${base_pay_per_shift} per 8-hour shift and she works {num_days} days and makes {num_days} * ${base_pay_per_shift} = $<<{base_pay_per_shift}*{num_days}={total_base_pay}>>{total_base_pay}

Her overtime pay is ${overtime_hourly_rate} per hour and she works {overtime_hours_per_day} hours of overtime per day and makes {overtime_hourly_rate}*{overtime_hours_per_day} = $<<{overtime_hourly_rate}*{overtime_hours_per_day}={overtime_pay_per_day}>>{overtime_pay_per_day} in overtime pay
{overtime_hours_per_day} hours of overtime pay for {num_days} days means she makes {overtime_pay_per_day}*{num_days} = ${total_overtime_pay}

In {num_days} days her base pay is ${total_base_pay} and she makes ${total_overtime_pay} in overtime pay so she makes ${total_base_pay} + ${total_overtime_pay} = $<<{total_base_pay}+{total_overtime_pay}={total_pay}>>{total_pay}
